newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican president welcomes Philippines' Ramos.
newsitem.headline: Mexican president welcomes Philippines' Ramos.

text.p: Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo welcomed Philippine leader Fidel Ramos on Monday at the official start of a state visit intended to strengthen economic, political and cultural ties between their nations.

Ramos received traditional red carpet treatment on meeting Zedillo in the National Palace. Both leaders stressed their desire to improve links between two Pacific Rim countries that belong to the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.
"Mexico is very interested in contributing to achieving the common goal of liberalising trade and investments between the economies of the Pacific Rim," Zedillo said at the welcoming ceremony.
Ramos' message was just as direct. "We intend to strengthen economic, political and cultural ties between Mexico and the Philippines, also improving our cooperation via APEC," he said.
The two nations expect to sign eight accords during Ramos' state visit, which is scheduled to end on Tuesday when Ramos leaves for Panama, the office of Mexico's president said.

Ramos arrived in Mexico on Friday at the Pacific resort of Acapulco with a delegation of some 60 businessmen. On Sunday he flew to the port of Veracruz on the other side of Mexico and inaugurated a container terminal.
